description.narrative:
In line with the United Nations Refugee and Host Population Empowerment (REHOPE) framework and the Government of Uganda#s Settlement Transformation Agenda, the South Sudan Refugee Response seeks to support both the emergency needs of recently arrived refugees, and medium to long-term interventions to support both refugees and their host communities, focusing on economic stabilization, prevention and response to sexual and gender based violence (SGBV) and improved service delivery. The goal of the South Sudan refugee response program is to save lives, reduce suffering and inequality; protect human dignity for female as well as male refugees and host community members in targeted regions of Uganda. To achieve this goal, three strategies will be employed: First, direct response to the refugee needs; Secondly, building capacity and influencing humanitarian programming of the Government, NGO partners and UNHCR; and thirdly, feeding evidence and gained experience to national, regional and global campaign on humanitarian needs and rights of the vulnerable OXFAM will support initiatives aimed at continued stability of refugees and host communities, and service provision. Priority sectors for OXFAM will be WASH, gender and protection, Emergency food security and vulnerable livelihoods and Advocacy and influencing. The focus will be on stabilization of the targeted refugee settlement areas of Rhino Camp and Imvepi (in Arua), Bidibidi (in Yumbe) and Palabek (in Lamwo) where emergency services have to transition to more stable and sustainable service provision arrangements. Progammes will include peace building and advocacy, gender mainstreaming, research, adoption of new sustainable technologies and support to affected district authority systems to strengthen their service delivery in refugee hosting areas (priority sectors: Water, Sanitation, Hygiene, Protection and Livelihoods). Oxfam will aim at ensuring that activities in all sectors are gender sensitive, environmentally friendly and contribute to reduce the increased pressure on natural resources. This is essential to reduce conflict between refugees and host community.
Enhanced capacity of 29,966 vulnerable refugees and local host community members to identify, prevent, mitigate and address Sexual and Gender Based Violence and protection risks. Project outcomes 1. Increased awareness and action to prevent to SGBV and protection risks among refugees and host communities as well as schools. 2. Increased sense of dignity and safety among vulnerable refugee as well as host community women and girls.

participating-org.narrative: African Women and Youth Action for Development (AWYAD) is a Non-Government Organization (NGO) founded by Christians with a deep concern for vulnerable youth and women in Uganda, South Sudan, Kenya and Tanzania in the East African Region, living in abjectpoverty and whose voices cannot be heard. AWYAD was established 2010, by Christians with a passion to support vulnerable youth and women groups in various parts of the region, where 78% of youth are enslaved in the war of want, unintended self-torture, unproductiveness, crime, hunger and stress due to poverty as a result of joblessness and hopelessness. Over 70% of women in many rural communities live through untold suffering caused by horror of poverty associated with cultural and economic injustices such as discrimination and unpaid labour which is both on and off farm. During emergencies like sever famine and hunger and displacement, women and children suffer most from the consequences of the disaster. In order to overcome these challenges, AWYAD isdriven with a passion to work and advocate for change that eradicates the causes of poverty, discrimination and injustice striving to achieve equality, voice and empowerment. The organization targets vulnerable youth between the age of 15 <(>&<)> 30 years andvulnerable women including young single mothers, widows, women with HIV and disability with competitive skills and knowledge on agro business, promoting talent, innovation andentrepreneurship as well as nurturing and mentoring youth and women leaders withskills to influence, participate in decision makingfor the development of their families, their communities and nation.
